diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Primary Growth Hormone Insensitivity (GHI) due to compound heterozygous mutations of the Growth Hormone Receptor (GHR) gene
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis is supported by the clinical presentation of postnatal growth failure, elevated serum GH levels, low serum IGF-I levels, and the identification of two novel compound heterozygous mutations (C94S and H150Q) in the GHR gene, which were shown to impair GH signaling and gene expression.
